intro: Austrobaeckea narembeen, commonly known as the Narembeen gum tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, white or cream-colored flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Austrobaeckea narembeen is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions. Its ecological significance includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
